1: An Instruction of David. Blessed are they, whose unrighteousness is forgiven, and whose sins are covered.
2: Blessed is the man, unto whom the LORD imputeth no sin, in whose spirit there is no guile.
3: For while I held my tongue, my bones consumed away thorow my daily complainings.
4: And because thy hand was so heavy on me both day and night, my moisture was like the drought in Summer. Selah.
5: Therefore I confessed my sin unto thee, and hid not mine unrighteousness. I said: I will knowledge my offense, and accuse my self unto the LORD, and so thou forgavest me the wickedness of my sin. Selah.
6: For this shall every saint make his prayer unto thee in due season, therefore shall not the great water floods come nigh him.
7: Thou art my defense in the trouble that is come about me, O compass thou me about also with the joy of deliverance. Selah.
8: I will enform thee, and shew thee the way wherein thou shalt go: I will fasten mine eyes upon thee.
9: Be not ye now like horses and mules, which have no understanding. Whose mouths thou must hold with bit and bridle, if they will not obey thee.
10: Great plagues shall the ungodly have, but who so putteth his trust in the LORD, mercy shall compass him on every side.
11: Be glad, O ye righteous, and rejoice in the LORD, be joyful all ye that are true of heart.
